SEARCH
Module it.polimi.sw.gianpaolocugola47
Package it.polimi.sw.gianpaolocugola47.model

Class PlayerTable

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.sw.gianpaolocugola47.model.PlayerTable
public class PlayerTable extends Object
This class represents the player's board, it contains all the card of the player(starting card, played card, secret objective card), the nickName, the id, the first token(if he's first), the point on the board, all the point included the secret objective and the resource counter.

    • getMatrixDimension

      public static int getMatrixDimension()
      This method returns the matrix dimension. The matrix is a square, so both borders are equal.
      Returns:
      : the matrix dimension.

    • getStartingCardPos

      public static int getStartingCardPos()
      This method returns the starting card position. It is at the centre of the board, so row and column position are the same.
      Returns:
      : the starting card position.

    • turnCardOnHand

      public void turnCardOnHand(int cardPosition, boolean isFront)
      Changes the side of the card in the specified hand position.
      Parameters:

      isFront - : true if the card is front, false otherwise.

    • checkAndPlaceCard

      public int checkAndPlaceCard(int onHandCard, int onTableCardX, int onTableCardY, int onTableCardCorner)
      This method checks if a card can be placed on another one and places it if that's the case.
      Parameters:
      onHandCard - Card on player's hand, to be placed.
      onTableCardX - X coordinate of on table card.
      onTableCardY - Y coordinate of on table card.
      onTableCardCorner - corner's id from 0 to 3 (independently of front/back).
      Returns:
      the points made by the player if the card has been placed, else returns -1.

    • setXCoordinate

      public int setXCoordinate(int x, int corner)
      This method sets the x coordinate of a card depending on the corner. If a card is to be placed on the top corners of the card (0,1), this method returns x - 1, since the card to be placed will be on the row above the card already on the board; Corners 2 and 3 are the bottom corners, so the x coordinate is x + 1.
      Parameters:
      x - : row coordinate of the card already present on the board.
      corner - : corner of the card already present on the board that is to be covered by the new card.
      Returns:
      the x coordinate of the card to be placed. -1 if the input is incorrect.

    • setYCoordinate

      public int setYCoordinate(int y, int corner)
      This method sets the y coordinate of a card depending on the corner. If a card is to be placed on the left corners of the card (0,2), this method returns y - 1, since the card to be placed will be on the column to the left of the card already on the board; Corners 1 and 3 are the right corners, so the y coordinate is y + 1.
      Parameters:
      y - : column coordinate of the card already present on the board.
      corner - : corner of the card already present on the board that is to be covered by the new card.
      Returns:
      the y coordinate of the card to be placed. -1 if the input is incorrect.

    • isPlaceable

      public boolean isPlaceable(int x, int y)
      This method checks if a card can be placed on the table at the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - : row coordinate of the card to be placed.
      y - : column coordinate of the card to be placed.
      Returns:
      : true if the card can be placed, false otherwise.

    • getObjectivePoints

      public int getObjectivePoints(Objectives[] objectives)
      This method returns the points made by the player with both the secret and the shared objectives.
      Parameters:
      objectives - : the shared objectives of the game.
      Returns:
      : the points made by the player.

    • checkIfCanPlay

      public void checkIfCanPlay()
      Checks if the player can play any card on the board. If the board is full, the player is stuck. Sets canPlay to false if the player can't play any card.

    • setNickname

      public void setNickname(String nicknameLocal)
      Sets the player's nickname.
      Parameters:
      nicknameLocal - : the player's nickname.

    • setCardsOnHand

      Parameters:
      cardsOnHand - : the cards on the player's hand.

    • setCardOnHand

      public void setCardOnHand(int position, ResourceCard cardOnHand)
      Sets a card on a player's specific hand position.
      Parameters:
      position - : hand's position.
      cardOnHand - : the card to be set in that position.

    • getCardIdMatrix

      public int[][] getCardIdMatrix()
      Used for serializing the player table to json, since the PlacedCard matrix is not serializable. Returns an int matrix with card's id are present at the coordinates of the respective cards, and -1 is set where the position is null.
      Returns:
      : the card id matrix.

    • getCardSideMatrix

      public boolean[][] getCardSideMatrix()
      Used for serializing the player table to json, since the PlacedCard matrix is not serializable. Returns a boolean matrix where empty positions and back-played cards' positions are set false and front-played cards' are set true.
      Returns:
      : th

    • idMatrixToCardMatrix

      public void idMatrixToCardMatrix(int[] resourceCounterParameter)
      This method is used to convert the id matrix and the side matrix to the card matrix. If the id is set to -1 in the id matrix, null is placed at those coordinates. The card with the respective id is set to the correct side and then placed and linked with the remaining cards elsewhere. A resource counter parameter is used to correctly update the resource counter of the player, since the placeStartingCard method overrides it and doubles the resources when loading from json.
      Parameters:
      resourceCounterParameter - : the resource counter of the player, loaded from the json file.

    • setCardIdMatrix

      public void setCardIdMatrix(int[][] cardIdMatrix)
      This method sets the card id matrix. Used when parsing from json.
      Parameters:
      cardIdMatrix - : the card id matrix.

    • setCardSideMatrix

      public void setCardSideMatrix(boolean[][] cardSideMatrix)
      This method sets the card side matrix. Used when parsing from json.
      Parameters:
      cardSideMatrix - : the card side matrix.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      This method returns the player's board as a string.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      : the player's board as a string.

    • getPlaceOrder

      public ArrayList<int[]> getPlaceOrder()
      This method returns the arraylist containing the order in which the cards were placed on the board, characterized by the coordinates of a given card. The order of insertion in the arraylist is equivalent to the order of insertion in the card matrix.
      Returns:
      : arraylist of card's coordinates from least to most recent card placed.

    • setPlaceOrder

      public void setPlaceOrder(ArrayList<int[]> placeOrder)
      This method sets the arraylist containing the order in which the cards were placed on the board, characterized by the coordinates of a given card. The order of insertion in the arraylist is equivalent to the order of insertion in the card matrix.
      Parameters:
      placeOrder - : the arraylist of card's coordinates, from least to most recent card placed.
